item.title: 如果俄罗斯谈判取得进展，特朗普团队将考虑取消石油价格上限
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，如果与莫斯科就结束乌克兰战争的谈判取得进展，唐纳德-特朗普总统的顾问们正在勾画他可能取消或调整的对俄制裁措施，其中包括石油价格上限。【原文：Advisers to President Donald Trump are sketching out potential Russia sanctions he could lift or tweak — including the oil price cap — if there’s progress in talks with Moscow on ending its war in Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 詹妮弗-加纳的婴儿食品公司考虑最快今年上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由女演员詹妮弗-加纳（Jennifer Garner）共同创办的有机婴儿食品公司 Once Upon a Farm 正在考虑最快于今年进行首次公开募股。【原文：Once Upon a Farm, the organic baby food company co-founded by actress Jennifer Garner, is considering an initial public offering as soon as this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国准备命令更多公司停止在委内瑞拉运营
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特朗普政府在下令雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）结束在委内瑞拉的业务后，正准备迫使更多公司停止在委内瑞拉的业务，从而加大对总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗的压力。【原文：The Trump administration is preparing to force more companies to stop working in Venezuela, increasing pressure on President Nicolas Maduro after ordering Chevron Corp. to end operations there, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 墨西哥财政部长拉米雷斯-德拉奥提出辞职
item.description: 墨西哥财政部长罗赫略-拉米雷斯-德拉奥（Rogelio Ramirez de la O）在担任国家预算最高负责人三年多后，于周五递交了辞呈。【原文：Mexico Finance Minister Rogelio Ramirez de la O tendered his resignation on Friday after more than three years as the top official in charge of the nation’s budget, according to a person familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 力拓放弃出售股票筹资 50 亿美元的计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在投资者的反对下，力拓集团已经取消了通过出售股票筹集多达 50 亿美元资金的计划。【原文：Rio Tinto Group has scrapped plans to raise as much as $5 billion in a share sale following pushback from investors, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 苹果公司确认推迟推出人工智能个性化 Siri 助手
item.description: 苹果公司证实，该公司将推迟发布新的人工智能 Siri 数字助理，并表示该公司目前预计将在 "未来一年 "的某个时候推出该软件。【原文：Apple Inc. confirmed that it’s delaying the release of a new AI-infused Siri digital assistant, saying the company now expects to roll out the software sometime “in the coming year.”】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司为可能的特别管理制定计划
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，泰晤士河水务公司正在为下周在伦敦一家法院提起上诉后可能被推入特别管理部门做准备。【原文：Thames Water is preparing for the possibility that it may be pushed into special administration following an appeal in a London court next week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 关税冲击给 Target 和 Costco 的前景和价格蒙上阴影
item.description: Target Corp. is padding its cash reserves and preparing to raise prices. Burlington Stores Inc. is tightening its grip on inventory. And Costco Wholesale Corp. expects to take action — even if it’s not yet sure what that will entail.

item.title: 黑格塞斯指示五角大楼标准化并加快软件购买速度
item.description: 国防部长皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth）已指示国防部规范并加快软件采购方法；这是五角大楼采购流程现代化和改善非传统创新供应商准入的更广泛计划的一部分。【原文：Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has directed the department to standardize and speed up its approach to software purchasing — part of a broader plan to modernize the Pentagon’s buying process and improve access for nontraditional and innovative vendors.】

item.title: 加拿大推出 45 亿美元计划援助受关税影响的企业
item.description: 加拿大政府官员周五宣布，加拿大政府将拨款 65 亿加元（45 亿美元），帮助出口商为加拿大产品开拓新市场，并帮助企业应对关税战。【原文：The Canadian government will deploy C$6.5 billion ($4.5 billion) to help exporters reach new markets for Canadian products and help companies navigate the tariff war, officials announced Friday.】

item.title: 马斯克两极分化，前景黯淡，特斯拉的 "特朗普热潮 "不复存在
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普赢得美国总统大选后的几周内，投资者向特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.仅仅四个月后，这个赌注就变成了股市中最大的失败之一。【原文：In the weeks after Donald Trump won the US presidential election, investors pumped more than $700 billion into Tesla Inc. shares, betting that Elon Musk’s relationship with the commander in chief and growing political prominence would pay off for the automaker. Barely four months later, that wager is shaping up to be one of the biggest duds of the equity market.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称仍无需急于考虑利率变动
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔承认美国经济前景的不确定性增加，但表示官员们不必急于调整政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell acknowledged increased uncertainty in the US economic outlook, but said officials don’t need to rush to adjust policy.】

item.title: 库格勒称美联储应保持利率稳定，并指出通胀风险
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，美国央行在 "一段时间内 "保持利率稳定可能是合适的，并指出通胀面临上行风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said it’s likely appropriate for the US central bank to hold interest rates steady for “some time,” pointing to upside risks to inflation.】

item.title: 特朗普称可能很快对加拿大征收乳制品和木材关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他可能最快于周五对加拿大的木材和乳制品实施对等关税，再次威胁要破坏跨境贸易。【原文：President Donald Trump said he may implement reciprocal tariffs on Canadian lumber and dairy products as soon as Friday, threatening again to disrupt crossborder trade.】

item.title: 墨西哥称多达 90% 的输美产品可享受关税减免
item.description: 墨西哥政府表示，多达 90% 的对美出口产品可从两国周四达成的关税减免协议中受益，这将大大降低严重依赖与北方邻国贸易的墨西哥经济放缓所面临的风险。【原文：Mexico’s government said that as much as 90% of exports to the US could benefit from the tariff relief deal the two nations reached Thursday, significantly reducing the risks to a slowing economy that is heavily dependent on trade with its northern neighbor.】

item.title: 卢特尼克认为美印协议涉及关税、武器和美元
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）表示，有机会与印度谈判达成一项广泛的贸易协定，以解决关税不平衡问题，以及对华盛顿来说棘手的问题，如这个南亚国家购买俄罗斯武器和参与金砖国家推动废除美元的行动。【原文：US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said there’s a chance to negotiate a broad trade agreement with India that addresses tariff imbalances as well as thorny issues for Washington like the South Asian nation’s purchase of Russian weapons and involvement in a BRICS push to dethrone the dollar.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 通过 34 亿美元的投资计划加大在墨西哥的投资力度
item.description: 拉丁美洲电子商务和支付巨头 MercadoLibre 公司正加倍努力发展墨西哥市场，计划今年在墨西哥投资创纪录的 34 亿美元。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc., the Latin America e-commerce and payments giant, is doubling down on its growth in Mexico with plans to invest a record $3.4 billion in the country this year.】

item.title: 纳斯达克 100 指数跌入调整，科技股跌势加剧

item.title: 关税削弱美国经济增长，美元迎来 2022 年以来最差一周
item.description: 由于交易商对美国的特殊主义产生反感，预计贸易政策将减缓全球最大经济体的增长速度，美元指数本周将创下两年多来的最差表现。【原文：A guage of the dollar is heading for its worst week in over two years as traders turn sour on US exceptionalism, expecting trade policies to slow down growth in the world’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 通用大西洋公司支持的 SMG 为瑞士首次公开募股寻找银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，经营在线房地产网站 ImmoScout24 的 SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG 已选定了首次公开募股的银行，该公司的估值可能在 50 亿美元左右。【原文：SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, which operates online real estate website ImmoScout24, has picked banks for an initial public offering that could value the firm at about $5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普关税令美加食品供应链陷入混乱
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战正在给美加边境两侧的农民和食品生产商造成混乱，因为企业正在努力解决如何切断几十年来相互关联的供应链。【原文：Donald Trump’s trade war is causing chaos for farmers and food producers on both sides of the US-Canada border, as businesses grapple with how to disentangle supply chains that have been interconnected for decades.】

item.title: 随着人口减少，俄罗斯人回避普京关于生育更多婴儿的呼吁
item.description: 尽管弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）总统宣布扭转人口结构是国家最重要的优先事项，但俄罗斯的人口仍在以自 19 世纪科维德大流行以来最快的速度下降。【原文：Russia’s population is declining at its quickest pace since the Covid-19 pandemic, even after President Vladimir Putin declared that a demographic turnaround is the country’s most important priority.】

item.title: 摩根大通称怀疑斯坦利参与了爱泼斯坦的犯罪活动
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）告诉英国监管机构，它认为杰斯-斯塔利（Jes Staley）可能参与了杰弗里-爱泼斯坦（Jeffrey Epstein）的犯罪活动，就在监管机构于 2019 年对这位前巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）老板展开正式调查前不久，一家法院周五听到了这一消息。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. told British regulators it believed Jes Staley might have been involved in Jeffrey Epstein’s crimes, shortly before the watchdog opened a formal investigation into the former Barclays Plc boss in 2019, a court heard Friday.】
